text.english: Teorema: The length of the list obtained by appending two lists is equal to the sum of the lengths of the two lists, i.e. \[ \forall l_1,l_2 \in L_A .\; \texttt{len}(\texttt{app}(l_1,\;l_2)) = \texttt{len}(l_1) + \texttt{len}\;l_2) \]
text.italiano: Teorema: La lunghezza della lista ottenuta concatenando due liste Ã¨ equivalente alla somma delle lunghezze delle due liste, i.e. \[ \forall l_1,l_2 \in L_A .\; \texttt{len}(\texttt{app}(l_1,\;l_2)) = \texttt{len}(l_1) + \texttt{len}\;l_2) \]

theorem.coq: Theorem len_app : forall l1 l2 : list , len (app l1 l2) = len l1 + len l2.
